DOC.brief_summary: The study shall provide evidence for the save and efficient use of a fish oil containing lipid emulsion in parenteral nutrition of preterm infants.Safety will be assessed by monitoring hepatological and hematological laboratory parameters. Efficiency will be assessed by monitoring of inflammatory parameters.
DOC.brief_title: Comparison of Two Different Lipid Emulsions for Parenteral Nutrition in Preterm Infants
DOC.criteria: prematurity (birth weight 500 1500 g) postnatal age <= 72 h need for cumulative parenteral energy supply of at least 70% during study duration signed informed consent form simultaneous participation in another clinical study platelet count below 50000 /ml cumulative enteral energy supply of > 30 % during study duration serious congenital infections and/or diseases serious metabolic disturbances severe cranial bleeding (Papile III, IV) need for administration of blood products contraindication for iv lipid administration withdrawal of consent
